_thread_replies.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
To remove Lamb from the funnel for W49 boxes:

1. Schedule the task for the next sprint
2. Implement the change by 11/25
3. This will affect orders starting from W49

Key points:
* Removal date: *11/25*
* Impact: Orders from *W49* onwards
* Action: *Schedule* into next sprint

Ensure to communicate this change to relevant teams, especially those handling menu planning and inventory management.
 *Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FVDBJZCK/p1734289546294759?thread_ts=1734289546.294759&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] New Recipe Meal Slots>

<@U0177S413PC>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Adjust Calorie Algorithm `
*Topic:* `Adding a new feature/capability`
*Details:* `We would like to add a haircut to the current calorie algorithm. 5% haircut for adult calorie calculations and a 10% haircut for puppy. Can you please share all of the current calorie algorithm calculations and I can reshare the formula with the haircuts? `

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question
attachments.text:
<@U0177S413PC>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Adjust Calorie Algorithm `
*Topic:* `Adding a new feature/capability`
*Details:* `We would like to add a haircut to the current calorie algorithm. 5% haircut for adult calorie calculations and a 10% haircut for puppy. Can you please share all of the current calorie algorithm calculations and I can reshare the formula with the haircuts? `

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question

_thread_replies.text: <@U03UMPD2NNS>

:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 

Here are the current calorie algorithm calculations for dogs:

1. *Inactive adults, active/overweight adults, very active/overweight adults*:
   `Math.Floor(Math.Pow(weightInKg, 0.75) * 70)`

2. *Active slim & just right adults*:
   `Math.Floor(Math.Pow(weightInKg, 0.75) * 70 * 1.1)`

3. *Very active slim & just right adults*:
   `Math.Floor(Math.Pow(weightInKg, 0.75) * 70 * 1.2)`

4. *Puppies*:
   `Math.Floor(Math.Pow(weightInKg, 0.75) * 70 * 2)`

To apply the haircuts you mentioned:
- For adults: Multiply the result by 0.95 (5% haircut)
- For puppies: Multiply the result by 0.90 (10% haircut)

Note: The current logic rounds down to the nearest product for adults and finds the closest product within a 50 cal range for puppies.

For more details, please visit <https://hellodev.hellofresh.io/docs/default/repository/nutritional-profile-service/?utm_source=slack-commander|here>
 *Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FVDBJZCK/p1681845934793039?thread_ts=1681845934.793039&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Puppy Weight Limit>
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04SQ59BWG4/p1687798036016329?thread_ts=1687798036.016329&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Calories (kcal) vs Energy (kJ) - BE (and NL)> :warning:_This answer was generated based on the available documentation mentioned above, proceed with caution._

Does this resolve your query, <@U0177S413PC>? Unified Search :mag: button

:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 

Here are the current calorie algorithm calculations for dogs:

1. *Inactive adults, active/overweight adults, very active/overweight adults*:
   `Math.Floor(Math.Pow(weightInKg, 0.75) * 70)`

2. *Active slim & just right adults*:
   `Math.Floor(Math.Pow(weightInKg, 0.75) * 70 * 1.1)`

3. *Very active slim & just right adults*:
   `Math.Floor(Math.Pow(weightInKg, 0.75) * 70 * 1.2)`

4. *Puppies*:
   `Math.Floor(Math.Pow(weightInKg, 0.75) * 70 * 2)`

To apply the haircuts you mentioned:
- For adults: Multiply the result by 0.95 (5% haircut)
- For puppies: Multiply the result by 0.90 (10% haircut)

_thread_replies.text: For puppies, I still need the formulas, I just received 1

elements.text: For puppies, I still need the formulas, I just received 1

Anisha, here are the calculations: MinDogAgeInMonths: 2

Calories:
  - Name: All inactive adults + active/overweight adults + very active/overweight adults
    Condition: >
      !isPuppy && (
        activityLevel == activityLevels.INACTIVE ||
        (activityLevel == activityLevels.ACTIVE && bodyCondition == bodyConditions.OVER_WEIGHT) ||
        (activityLevel == activityLevels.VERY_ACTIVE && bodyCondition == bodyConditions.OVER_WEIGHT)
      )

- Name: Active slim & just right adults
    Condition: >
      !isPuppy && (
        activityLevel == activityLevels.ACTIVE &&
        (bodyCondition == bodyConditions.HEALTHY_WEIGHT || bodyCondition == bodyConditions.UNDER_WEIGHT)
      )

- Name: Very active slim & just right adults
    Condition: >
      !isPuppy && (
        activityLevel == activityLevels.VERY_ACTIVE &&
        (bodyCondition == bodyConditions.HEALTHY_WEIGHT || bodyCondition == bodyConditions.UNDER_WEIGHT)
      )

- Name: Large puppies 12-18 months
    Condition: >
      isPuppy && (
        size == sizes.LARGE &&
        age > 12 && age <= 18
      )

- Name: All puppies 10-12 months
    Condition: >
      isPuppy && (
        age > 10 && age <= 12
      )

- Name: All puppies 6-10 months
    Condition: >
      isPuppy && (
        age > 6 && age <= 10
      )

- Name: All puppies 4-6 months
    Condition: >
      isPuppy && (
        age > 4 && age <= 6
      )

- Name: All puppies 2-4 months
    Condition: >
      isPuppy && (
        age >= 2 && age <= 4
      )

Thanks Maria, here are the modified calculations:

MinDogAgeInMonths: 2

Calories:
  - Name: All inactive adults + active/overweight adults + very active/overweight adults
    Condition: >
      !isPuppy && (
        activityLevel == activityLevels.INACTIVE ||
        (activityLevel == activityLevels.ACTIVE && bodyCondition == bodyConditions.OVER_WEIGHT) ||
        (activityLevel == activityLevels.VERY_ACTIVE && bodyCondition == bodyConditions.OVER_WEIGHT)
      )

- Name: Active slim & just right adults
    Condition: >
      !isPuppy && (
        activityLevel == activityLevels.ACTIVE &&
        (bodyCondition == bodyConditions.HEALTHY_WEIGHT || bodyCondition == bodyConditions.UNDER_WEIGHT)
      )

- Name: Very active slim & just right adults
    Condition: >
      !isPuppy && (
        activityLevel == activityLevels.VERY_ACTIVE &&
        (bodyCondition == bodyConditions.HEALTHY_WEIGHT || bodyCondition == bodyConditions.UNDER_WEIGHT)
      )

- Name: Large puppies 12-18 months
    Condition: >
      isPuppy && (
        size == sizes.LARGE &&
        age > 12 && age <= 18
      )

- Name: All puppies 10-12 months
    Condition: >
      isPuppy && (
        age > 10 && age <= 12
      )

- Name: All puppies 6-10 months
    Condition: >
      isPuppy && (
        age > 6 && age <= 10
      )

- Name: All puppies 4-6 months
    Condition: >
      isPuppy && (
        age > 4 && age <= 6
      )

- Name: All puppies 2-4 months
    Condition: >
      isPuppy && (
        age >= 2 && age <= 4
      )

<@U05BNQPJX4K>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question. Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Staging Pricing API issues for TPT`
*Topic:* `Web`
*Details:* `I was just attempting to create an account on Staging for TPT and I'm seeing an error for the price endpoint. I'm not able to reproduce this on any other brands. I've tried GoodChop, Factor, and HF on staging and they're all working. I repeatedly get this error when attempting to sign up on TPT in staging.

`
*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* launch-ask
attachments.text:
<@U05BNQPJX4K>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question. Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Staging Pricing API issues for TPT`
*Topic:* `Web`
*Details:* `I was just attempting to create an account on Staging for TPT and I'm seeing an error for the price endpoint. I'm not able to reproduce this on any other brands. I've tried GoodChop, Factor, and HF on staging and they're all working. I repeatedly get this error when attempting to sign up on TPT in staging.

`
*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* launch-ask

_thread_replies.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
Based on the provided context, it appears that there are ongoing issues with the pricing service on the staging environment. Here's a summary of the problem and potential steps:

1. The issue is affecting multiple brands, including TPT, GoodChop, and Mr. (Marley Spoon).
2. The error occurs during account creation and checkout processes.
3. The price-service is returning a 400 error, which is causing a 500 error in the payment service.

To troubleshoot:

1. Try creating a fresh session and attempt the process again.
2. If the issue persists, it may be a broader problem with the staging environment.
3. Check the logs for more details. A sample error message shows:

```
"failed to calculate price: could not request price-service: failed to request server (code: 400)"
```

4. The error might be related to invalid business division or region code combinations.

This appears to be a known issue that has been reported to the relevant team. It's recommended to wait for an update from the team responsible for the pricing service.

For more details, please visit <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C06DQ4CL8AW/p1747404095461429?thread_ts=1747404095.461429&utm_source=slack-commander|here>
 *Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C06DQ4CL8AW/p1737473304625969?thread_ts=1737473304.625969&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Error saving add-ons>
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C06DQ4CL8AW/p1740734441331559?thread_ts=1740734441.331559&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Price Service is returning error on staging> :warning:_This answer was generated based on the available documentation mentioned above, proceed with caution._

Does this resolve your query, <@U05BNQPJX4K>? Unified Search :mag: button

text.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
Based on the provided context, it appears that there are ongoing issues with the pricing service on the staging environment. Here's a summary of the problem and potential steps:

1. The issue is affecting multiple brands, including TPT, GoodChop, and Mr. (Marley Spoon).
2. The error occurs during account creation and checkout processes.
3. The price-service is returning a 400 error, which is causing a 500 error in the payment service.

To troubleshoot:

1. Try creating a fresh session and attempt the process again.
2. If the issue persists, it may be a broader problem with the staging environment.
3. Check the logs for more details. A sample error message shows:

```
"failed to calculate price: could not request price-service: failed to request server (code: 400)"
```

4. The error might be related to invalid business division or region code combinations.

This appears to be a known issue that has been reported to the relevant team. It's recommended to wait for an update from the team responsible for the pricing service.
